Risperidone appears to be a useful adjunct to clozapine in the treatment of acute schizophrenia. While the formal examination of sources of heterogeneity between studies has been important in the overall conclusions reached, these should be interpreted with caution. We were unable to reach definite conclusions about any adverse effects that might result from the use of exercise, because data reported in the trials are scarce.

Acupressure appears to be effective in preventing nausea and vomiting after cesarean section. In comparisons with epidural anesthesia, the antiemetic effects of prophylactic acupressure were less effective than those from epidural anesthesia. There is evidence that education and care management offered by podiatrists can improve patient outcomes and reduce the risk of foot complications in people with diabetes. This update of the review published in 2005 does not contain any new trials published in full. One new trial that has only been published as an abstract, does not show any benefit in patient outcomes from education and care management in people with diabetes.

There is evidence that family-based intervention can reduce pain and depressive symptoms in patients with cancer and their family caregivers. The evidence is not robust in patients with advanced cancer and their family caregivers because of the small number of participants in the studies, the heterogeneity of the assessment or the lack of detailed outcome information that prevented the possibility of cumulative analysis for several outcomes. Nevertheless it seems desirable to develop interventions that might make caregiving more effective.

There is insufficient evidence to assess the value of cognitive behaviour therapy for people with personality disorder. Most of the available studies are not of high methodological quality and further research is required.
There is evidence that different interventions can be used with patients with cancer to improve patient satisfaction and quality of life.

There is a evidence-based evidence that fluorosis is a risk factor for dental caries. Nevertheless it seems desirable to develop robust evidence-based reporting of fluorosis to support clinical outcomes.

There is no high quality evidence that tranexamic acid reduces postpartum bleeding. There is a need for more studies of high methodological quality.
